attributes.action: Addicts to receive treatment rather than punishment for minor related offences.
attributes.additional_details:
NHS National Treatment Agency For Substance Misuse (2011-2012)

UK Drug Policy Commission - Reducing Drug Use, Reducing Reoffending (2006-2007)
attributes.background: Drug Addiction is a treatable condition. Drug treatment not only save lives and communities but prevents an estimated 4.9m crimes every year saving an estimated £960,000,000. Criminal Punishments cost society far more and our high re-offending rates among problem drug users prove they do not work.
